channel.title: dictknife on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in dictknife on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] I want to merge a nested dict in python
item.description: I wanted to merge a nested dict, but I can't find any suitable articles. For the time being, make a dict. dict1 = { "depth1_a": "x1a", "depth1_b": "x1b", "depth2_1": { "depth2_a": "x2a", "depth2_b": "x2b" }, "depth3_1": { "depth3_2": { "depth3_3_a": "x33a", "depth3_3_b": "x33b" } } } dict2 = { "depth1_a": "y1a", "depth1_c": "y1c", "depth2_1": { "depth2_a": "y2a", "depth2_c": "y2c" }, "depth3_1": { "depth3_2": { "depth3_3_a": "y33a", "depth3_3_c": "y33c" } } } What I want as a result is that “depthx_a” will be overwritten with the value of dict2, and “depthx_b” and “depthx_c” will both remain.
